chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eli Samuel Spears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:24 AM Defendant Eli Samuel Spears in court.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court for Eli Samuel Spears.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead no contest to count 2. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2. Count 1 is dismissed and read in. Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation. As conditions of probation, defendant is to complete any treatment recommended by DOC. Court orders restitution in the amount of $614.40 plus surcharges due within 60 days. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit zero days.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
